title: Customer Revenue (Paid Invoices)
prompt:
Tables (SQLite):
- Customers(id, name)
- Projects(id, name, customer_id)
- Invoices(id, project_id, amount, status, issued_date)

Return total paid invoice amount per customer (only status='PAID'), ordered by total_amount desc. Starter query has a GROUP BY bug.

code:
SELECT c.name, SUM(i.amount) AS total_amount
FROM Customers c
JOIN Projects p ON p.customer_id = c.id
JOIN Invoices i ON i.project_id = p.id
WHERE i.status = 'PAID'
GROUP BY c.id, c.name, i.amount
ORDER BY total_amount DESC;

output: SQL error: SQLITE_ERROR: no such column: i.status

code:
WITH paid AS (
  SELECT project_id, SUM(amount) AS total_paid
  FROM Invoices
  WHERE status = 'PAID'
  GROUP BY project
)
SELECT c.name AS customer_name, p.name AS project_name, paid.total_paid
FROM paid
JOIN Projects p ON p.id = paid.project
JOIN Customers c ON c.id = p.customer
ORDER BY total_paid DESC
LIMIT 5;

title: Top Projects by Paid Amount
prompt:
Tables (SQLite):
- Customers(id, name)
- Projects(id, name, customer_id)
- Invoices(id, project_id, amount, status, issued_date)

Using a CTE, return the top 5 projects by total paid invoice amount, including customer name, project name, and total_paid. Starter query has join/alias mistakes.

code:
WITH paid AS (
  SELECT project_d, SUM(amount) AS total_paid
  FROM Invoices
  WHERE status = 'PAID'
  GROUP BY project
)
SELECT c.name AS customer_name, p.name AS project_name, paid.total_paid
FROM paid
JOIN Projects p ON p.id = paid.project
JOIN Customers c ON c.id = p.customer
ORDER BY total_paid DESC
LIMIT 5;

WITH paid AS (
  SELECT projectId, SUM(amount) AS total_paid
  FROM Invoices
  WHERE status = 'PAID'
  GROUP BY project
)
SELECT c.name AS customer_name, p.name AS project_name, paid.total_paid
FROM paid
JOIN Projects p ON p.id = paid.project
JOIN Customers c ON c.id = p.customer
ORDER BY total_paid DESC
LIMIT 5;

WITH paid AS (
  SELECT projectId, SUM(amount) AS total_paid
  FROM Invoices
  WHERE status =
  GROUP BY project
)

FROM paid
JOIN Projects p ON p.id = paid.project
JOIN Customers c ON c.id = p.customer
ORDER BY total_paid DESC
LIMIT 5;

WITH paid AS (
  SELECT projectId, SUM(amount) AS total_paid
  FROM Invoices
  WHERE status = 1
  GROUP BY project
)

LIMIT 5;

Aurora Tech Solutions | Customer Data Hub            | 100000    
Acme Manufacturing    | Inventory Optimization Pilot | 90000     
Acme Manufacturing    | Plant Maintenance Portal     | 50000

code:
WITH paid AS (
  SELECT projectId, SUM(amount) AS total_paid
  FROM Invoices
  WHERE ispaid = 1
  GROUP BY projectId
) 
SELECT c.name AS customer_name, p.name AS project_name, paid.total_paid
FROM paid
JOIN Projects p ON p.id = paid.projectId
JOIN Customers c ON c.id = p.customerId
ORDER BY total_paid DESC
LIMIT 5;

text:
customer_name         | project_name                 | total_paid
----------------------+------------------------------+-----------
Global Retail Group   | E-Commerce Revamp            | 120000    
Aurora Tech Solutions | Customer Data Hub            | 100000    
Acme Manufacturing    | Inventory Optimization Pilot | 90000     
Acme Manufacturing    | Plant Maintenance Portal     | 50000

title: Fast Fibonacci Mod 1_000_000_007
prompt: Return fib(n) modulo 1_000_000_007 for n up to 1,000,000. The starter code is too slow and has a minor logic bug. Replace with an O(n) iterative solution (or faster).

title: Fibonacci with Memoization
prompt: Implement fib(n) efficiently using memoization (top-down). The starter code intends to use a memo dict but has a bug. Fix it so fib(35) runs fast.
